intro: Piptocarpha vasquezii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Piptocarpha vasquezii is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
